Reviews.Title: “It's ok!”
Reviews.Author: DaveyBoysTravels
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night, was a bit sceptical as the area didn't seem that nice, but the hotel was much needed after a long day. Decent size room, clean & comfy. Breakfast next morning was ok, waffles, muffins etc. Hotel is 5 mins walk from walk of fame & metro to get downtown. Friendly staff at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ale_Limbru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple, has parking and breakfast included. The location is very good, a 5 minute block from the walk of fame and the Chinese theater. The breakfast is good, but they only replenish stuff on-demand (when I pointed out there were no more eggs or yoghurt, they only added 3 eggs and 4 yoghurts). The main floor rooms are noisy, we could hear our second floor neighbors' steps & shower loud and clear (not their conversations though), which was quite annoying; as well as people on the hallways. Maybe the second floor is quieter. The personnel is not very helpful although they were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and property, staff not up to par.”
Reviews.Author: 892Michael_G
Reviews.Content: First the good. This is an awesome location if you intend to enjoy the attractions around Hollywood. One block from the walk of fame on Hollywood Blvd, Sunset Strip is steps around the corner. Santa Monica and Venice Beach a 20 min drive. The Hotel is a little dated but love the look and feel, kind of a villa feel with a central pool which is lit up in cool alternating colors at night, secure gated parking underground. The price for us was the big draw, as my wife works for Choice Hotels and we got a deep discount. Now for the not so good. The pool is always dirty. Six days into our stay (out of seven) and We have yet to see anyone clean or swim in the pool (it is directly outside of our door and window). On our second day we asked about the pool finter running, said our 10 year old would like to swim, was told it always runs but is silent. Never once saw any water movement at all. Took some pics of the debris on the surface. Gross. House keeping comes in once a day, changes bedding empties the trash and cleans the bathroom. They haven't vaccumed the carpet once, have knocked at the door at 930AM asking for towels for laundry (???) and have stopped and looked into our windows to see if we are in. Breakfast bar was small and crowded, that's fine. My wife asked about some 2% milk because it was emty and was told to use the skim dispenser, since they fill them all with the same milk regardless of how it's labeled. err ok. At one ponit the toilet was clogged, wife called the desk and they said "The plunger is outside the door from the office to the pool area". We went and got it and plunged our own toilet. The free WiFi works but VERY slow at .31mbps. TVs are HDTV but the satellite service is apparently not. Very low quality picture. We would actually stay here again because of the low, low rate we get. If paying full price we'd find somewhere else to stay. There are plenty in the area.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER GOING BACK !!!!”
Reviews.Author: TERESA H
Reviews.Content: My frieds and I stay there on Feb 24 2012. The first impresision was "it seem ok" but one we went inside it was horrible. The desk clerk ignore us fore like 5 minutes, i work in the hotel business and even if the clerk is really busy you can not ignore a guess!! after he ignore us he give us acttitude for checkin in 30 minutes before check in time. After we check in we had the worst time with the parking but the last drop was when we enter the room.. First the smell was horrible!!! the room didnt look clean at all ..the bathroom same story , it was really dirty We didnt feel confortable even taking our shoes off. it really was the worst expiriance ever. WE WOULD NEVER STAY AT THIS PLACE AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hollywood Location”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraB1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights with our 3 teenage sons at New Year. The rooms were pretty average condition but were clean and comfortable and we were out sightseeing long hours each day so we weren't there all that much. Hollywood is generally pretty seedy so it was great to have the fast food outlets on the corner just a short walk away. The breakfast served was fine but the breakfast room was really small. The hotel staff were friendly and mostly helpful. We had one mix up that I thought the staff could have avoided. The day shift desk person booked us a taxi to take us to the airport at 6am the following morning. When it didn't arrive on time, the night desk person had no idea what taxi company it was with so couldn't follow up on the booking. End result was we had to ring for a new taxi and missed our flight to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Would love to come back here!”
Reviews.Author: CaitlynFuku
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband flew thousands miles to get to Hollywood. We chose to stay at Quality Inn Near Walk of Fame Hollywood because of the good reviews we read from TripAdvisor. We booked online 1 month before departure date. Overall we satisfied with the Hotel. Check-in was very quick and smooth. It was 11pm when we arrived but the neighborhood around the Hotel still running busy many people walking around and restaurants was still opened. Burger King, 7 Eleven, Starbucks, Thai food, Hawaiian food just around the corner of the street.. It felt safe walking from Hotel to Walk of Fame at night even tho we found some homeless lingering around (but its not a problem, they didn't even bother us). The room was clean, king size bed was comfy, big space bathroom, clean bath-up, neat towels, flat LCD, hair dryer, microwave etc. The drawbacks were the noisy from the street and the same breakfast for each day, pretty lame. But overall the location and cleanliness just beat em all!! Would love to come back there!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: caffeinefiend551
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very satisfied with our stay here. The price was very reasonable and we had an open mind about a non-4 star hotel, especially during a crazy Christmas weekend. Even though we arrived 2 hours before check-in, we were allowed to park our car in the underground parking lot, which allows entry only with a hotel key card that the desk clerk gave to us early. Therefore, we did not have to pay for a parking garage in Hollywood while taking a tour bus during the day. Check-in was very smooth, and we liked our nonsmoking room very much. There were some recent renovations to the room- wall hangings and bedding on the more neutral side, brand new 2.7 cubic foot fridge, brand new flat screen Vizio, and microwave oven. Perfect for storing our road trip snacks and some leftover gourmet burgers from the 24 hour joint in the Roosevelt Hotel, which was also a few blocks from Quality Inn. There was also a coffee maker and a hair dryer. The breakfast nook was amazing. Available from 7-10am, there was a variety of choices such as cereal, mini muffins, croissants, toast, and of course the make-it-yourself waffle iron. It was very nice to get coffee and a solid bite to eat- which saved a lot of time and money before embarking on more sight seeing. Yes, it did get crowded, but if they served some doughnuts + coffee and called that continental breakfast, the breakfast nook would not have been nearly as popular. To address some shortcomings mentioned in other reviews: the the area is a little weathered, but it was a short enough walk to tourist central. Plus, there were many restaurants very close by for those who prefer to walk for all budgets. The pool was not maintained but in December, I didn't think anyone would want to take a dip. After all, this is not the Hilton where you can swim in a heated pool and soak in a jacuzzi. Since there is no elevator, I'd suggest that you request a first floor room if you are booking for a person who can't handle stairs. The underground parking lot is kind of cramped, but for the larger SUV's, there is parking right outside some of the first floor rooms, so no need to fret. For the price you pay in an area where you can walk and not pay for parking-- we were very happy with our choce. The tax was a bit crazy, but it's not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated, To Say The Least.”
Reviews.Author: tsmoore88
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here while we were in Hollywood for auditions and I have to say I was pleasently surprised with this place. Check in was smooth, the room was nice and big and the property felt very safe over all. Some people on here have been saying that the area is seedy or scary- that is hardly the case. Of course sketchy characters are going to be out late at night- it is Hollywood after all, it's like the old saying goes "Nothing good happens after 10 o'clock at night". During the day you see the area for what it is, a working class neighborhood that is bustling and not even the slightest bit offputting to those who weren't born with a silver spoon in their mouth. The market across the street is nice with fair prices, just do yourself a favor and miss the Burger King located near by, try the excellent Subway a few blocks down the street. I never tried the pool but it was closed from the public and for the most part private. Breakfast was awesome and the dining area is quite nice with lots of large windows for prime people watching. Over all I would highly recommend this place- the only drawback to my entire stay was the firm bed- it was pretty uncomfortable but that is just me.

Reviews.Title: “first impressions...not good!”
Reviews.Author: laura2306
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed here for three nights at the end of our honeymoon trip around california, ok so when we first arrived the taxi dropped us at the back door and it was pitch black..i immediately had doubts as the area is seemed rough. we checked in, the man at the desk was polite and helpful we went to our room and it was spacious and clean so that was the main thing. we headed out to eat but because we did not know the area we turned left out of the hotel and had burger king where they were tramps arguing ferociously this made me feel very uneasy and decided not to explore the area that night! the next morning we went to breakfast, small room already full with guests and the free breakfast was waffles,toast or cereal. the pool was filthy..not that we would have gone in. the room had marks on the wall and could have done with a lick of paint but sheets and towels were clean. if you turn right out of the hotel and right again you are at the walk of fame, just a short walk from chinese theatre and kodak. for location the hotel was bang on, if your on a budget it is also ok but if you can afford to splurge a bit then i advise so especially if you are not familiar with the area. i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Chren
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite suitable for our needs. It is showing signs of age and could do with freshening up. We arrived early and they allowed us to leave the suitcases there and said they would have our room ready in a couple of hours, a few hours earlier that what we expected to move in. The staff were generally helpful. We were suprised by the continental breakfast they, after reading some reviews we did not expect to much but what we were presented with was more than adequate. Our only complaint about the breaksfast was that the breakfast room was a little on the small side and a couple of times we had to wait for a table. The location is good being only a short walk to central Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyV82
Reviews.Content: We went to Hollywood during the summer so hotel rooms were very expensive. We decided that we only needed a base as we would be out most of the time, and after reading the reviews thought this hotel would be okay for that. We have also stayed in Quality Inns before and always found them to be good value for money and very good budget hotels. The day we arrived, we had just left a beautiful hotel in Las Vegas and it was quite a shock when we arrived at the Quality Inn! The location of the hotel is not the prettiest. There is a lot of traffic in front of the hotel, some worn-out looking shops across the street and a few homeless people were sitting on the sidewalk. The outside of the hotel is pretty run down and painted a horrible shade of yellow. The promotional photographs on the hotel website do a good job of disguising this! After checking in and hauling our luggage up the stairs, the rooms were okay. Very dark and a bit run down but everything you need and the inside of the rooms were clean. We were due to stay for 5 nights but our initial thoughts were that we would stay one night and then try and get our money back and re-book elsewhere. After a very disappointing start to our Hollywood stay, we ventured out and soon remembered one of the reasons we had chosen this hotel. After just a few minutes walk we were on Hollywood Boulevard and all the famous landmarks were in sight. After our first night, which was a little noisy but nothing you wouldn't expect in a city, we headed down to find the breakfast room. The room is on the small side and there are not always seats available, but there was a good choice of food from cereal to freshly made waffles. Very convenient and a great money saver. On consideration of the amount of time we would actually be spending at the hotel (very little), we decided to make do and not try and change hotels. The great location saved us lots of time and money as we didn't need to take the car and as the room itself was clean, in the end it was fine. One issue which was quite annoying was that there are no safes in the room. You have to take your valuables down to reception and they place them in a safe deposit box. Although you are given the key to keep, the boxes are in a room at the back of reception and you can't actually see them which was a bit worrying. Also the parking is a little strange. As our hire car was quite large, we did not attempt to use the underground parking garage as the entrance was very narrow. There is parking at the side of the hotel but you have to choose your space carefully as there is a chance you may get blocked in overnight by the cars parking on the street. Overall, this hotel is fine for a cheap base in Hollywood which you don't plan on spending much time in. The location is really good once you get past the immediate surroundings and the rooms are fine. It is not the most attractive hotel and looks very run down from the outside. The pool area is not very inviting and we did not use it. If you are planning on spending time relaxing at the hotel, don't go here but if you just want a clean room to sleep in near the Hollywood attractions then it is ok but if we ever return to Hollywood, I would want to pay a bit more to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: E-Manny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horable and dirty. The first room I got had a really bad odder. The chair was ripped and had a pillow case covering it. The second room was dirty and run down. There was graffiti on the AC unit. I went to the front desk one night and the night clerk was drinking in the back. Very unfriendly staff. I would find some where else to stay. I am not picky I see the hotel as a place to stay but not this place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely filthy, please avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: I have literally just come back from my holiday in the US and my first port of call was to write a review on my experiences at the Quality Inn where I spent 7 nights in mid September. Myself and my wife are not picky whatsoever, we see a hotel as a place to rest our heads while we explore the sites of the city we are visiting - all we just ask for is that the hotel is clean; something which the Quality Inn was certainly not. I've read a number of reviews on the hotel before writing this and I am shocked that there are some people out there who have made positive remarks regarding their stay. I have to say this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in (and just to note I have stayed in a few bad ones). When we first arrived we were met by a homeless person who seemed to be having his dinner from the hotel's bin - which certainly set a precedent for the week ahead. The hotel's reception area is grotty and the pool area should be cordoned off because I cannot believe anybody should be allowed to go in there because it looked absolutely filthy - during our stay there I did not see one person attempt to go anywhere near it, which on reflection was a wise decision! When we entered the room we were met with this awful musty smell, and this was with us for the whole week, and I am sure it is still there now ruining some other poor couples' holiday! The pillows on the bed were stained, the carpet was filthy, the bath was unkempt and had hairs in it, the surfaces and light shades were covered in dust - do you want me to go on? I appreciate what people were saying about the staff being friendly, I do not dispute this, but every time I brought an issue to their attention all I received was a glazed look from them and a half hearted response that it would be resolved. However, I could tell straight away that these matters wouldnâ€™t be addressed; and they normally weren't. Just to reiterate, I wasnâ€™t making any outlandish requests, I appreciate this was a budget hotel - we just wanted to stay in a place which was clean and habitable. Unfortunately, I cannot provide you with comments on the breakfast, as given the standard of the rooms we did not dare go anywhere near the food. I donâ€™t want to just be providing completely negative remarks; the location of the hotel was good. It was a 2 minute walk from Hollywood Boulevard and a short distance from the Sunset strip and a 10/15 minute drive from Universal Studios. I never write on these types of forums normally but given my experiences at the Quality Inn I had to come on to advise everyone against staying here. Again, whilst I do acknowledge that the Quality Inn is a budget hotel, it still should have certain standards but unfortunately it failed to meet any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but rooms rather small and dark”
Reviews.Author: Cathy186298
Reviews.Content: Four of us were booked in a family room for 3 nights in August but decided that the room was just too small and dark so one member went to another hotel nearby. Rooms could really do with repainting in white to lighten them up. Cleanliness was very good in the room and the swimming pool was nice. Breakfast was good with a waffle maker and staff were friendly. The car park was very useful although very low ceilings so glad we didn't have a huge car. In a good location and very close to Hollywood Walk of Fame. Coffee Maker and Fridge in room. Would stay here again but only if there were 2 or 3 of us. The rooms were a bit noisy as lots of people seemed to be arriving and leaving throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: zarajennings
Reviews.Content: stayed at the end of august our room was good read other reviews saying it was dirty i found it to be fine no problems with cleanliness. my only big problem was noise all night long i was wakened by the sound of traffiic and im a heavy sleeper! bring ear plugs! the staff were friendly, location was excellent just a view minutes walk from hollywood walk of fame. would go back but would bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Iffy”
Reviews.Author: TND9350
Reviews.Content: If you can find a different place to stay, do it. Although the staff are very friendly this hotel is not very clean and is very noisy. The corners in the room are very dirty even dead bugs were there, the shower is moldy with some kind of black stuff on the shower curtain. The fridge never worked even after asking for someone to come look at it, and the wi-fi sucked! It worked sometimes for a few minutes and then died.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rsixtysix
Reviews.Content: Great location, all-round performer, esp swimming pool, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good localization but...maybe you can find something else.”
Reviews.Author: fseidl
Reviews.Content: The pros: cheap and walking distance from the walk of fame, Chinese Theater and some clubs. The staff is helpful and gentle. But, in LA you will probably rent a car, right, so, you can stay somewhere else and drive to this area. The Cons: noisy, dark, old rooms and the breakfast, well, the breakfast room is claustrophobic and the food tastes like nothing. Come on, Q-Inn: invest is some refurbishing and and take advantage of your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Frederic C
Reviews.Content: I had bookes through Travelocity top secret room for $97 with tax. When we arrived and got to our room it was a smoking room. I went back to the front desk asking for a non smoking room and the guy said theu were all reserved thats why i got the smoking room. We were able to live with it since it was only for one night. Other than that the hotel is well located, just one block away from hollywood boulvard and parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “An okay to place to rest your head...”
Reviews.Author: Karebear3434
Reviews.Content: But if you are looking for anything else...than you should go somewhere else. This place was definitely not the Ritz Carlton. It was pretty much no frills. What is was...in a perfect location within walking distance to Hollywood Blvd and the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater, etc. Very easy to get on all highways, etc. Also right next door to Jim Henson's Muppet Studio and also down the street from LA Ink (Kat vonD's place). For you movie buffs, the Pollo Loco fast food place where Brad Pitt got his start by dressing up as a chicken is right across the street. A very key thing was that they had free parking in a secure underground garage. Although we only used the parking garage once because we had an SUV, and the parking garage was very small, so it was hard to manuever under the ground, but they also had parking along side of the building too, which was safe. They had free breakfast every morning which there was always plenty of food available, (Even for late morning sleepers like us) they had your basic breakfast food, and the lady who ran the hotel made waffles. There were lots of convenience stores around, and a Target down the way, so if you forgot anything, you didn't have to go far. The hotel allowed smoking in the rooms and our room definately smelled like smoke. Other than that the room was clean, but very modestly decorated, like I mentioned no frills. One thing about this place, it is motel style, meaning the doors open to the outside and NOT a hallway. There were steel railings (like gates) with florals so you couldn't access the rooms from outside, but just beware there is no hallway. The front desk staff was really nice and they were helpful. This was a great place for the price. Under $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Joey090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights on the start of our two month road trip in the States. If you are on a budget and don't expect luxury, this is the place to stay in Hollywood! Location is excellent, only few minutes walk to Walk on fame, Kodak Theater and other sights on Hollywood boulevard. Also restaurants, shops and bars a short walk away. There is free secure underground parking which was a definite plus. OK if u have a massive car (like a lot of people seem to do in LA) it's not the most spacious one but during our stay we never had problem finding a parking space there. I thought having a car in LA is a must. I you don't mind the crazy traffic it really is the best way to see all the different areas. Our room was good size and clean with a comfortable bed and good shower. First night we had noisy neighbors, but thankfully they only stayed for one night. Apart from that it was as quiet as u can expect in a city. I found the staff over all friendly and helpful, I also liked the free breakfast, good coffee and freshly made waffles. The pool was filthy, didn't see anyone use it, but there is much better things to do in LA than lie around the pool. If I was to go to Hollywood again I would definitely consider returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Good Location and thats about it”
Reviews.Author: superjem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and tidy but needed redecorating and some light bulbs that actually give off some light. Its a very standard hotel - staff were not that helpful but the location made up for it. 5 min walk up the road and you are at the beginning of the walk of fame. The breakfast was good especially as it was free. Different things to choose from, dohgnuts, cakes, toast, cereal, pancake machine and juice although the lady looking after the breakfast was quite protective over her pancake machines! There was also wifi but you have to ask behind the desk for the code and only worked in reception! There is a starbucks around the corner, a ross dress for less and In N Out burger close by. All in all we would probably stay again due to the location and cost. If we were not on a budget we woudlnt have stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 'choice hotel'”
Reviews.Author: carlanglas
Reviews.Content: along my trip to the west coast of usa, I've stayed at many inns from 'choice hotels' with positive experiences, but this one was disappointing. Breakfast is a laugh, rooms are creepy, parking is packed and if you want to have some sleep, you'd better unplug the fridge to stop the noise.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in that price”
Reviews.Author: asaf2sh
Reviews.Content: we came to the states for a month long trip and LA was one of our stops and from all the hotels we stayed in during that month this one was the worst. i would like to start by saying that i didn't know the area before booking this hotel. i thought that the hollywood walk of fame would be a nice location, but that wasn't the case. the area is not very tourist friendly, besides the walk of fame there is not much to do in the area. the hotel itself was clean and had underground parking which was good, but it is not a hotel in a new condtion. the first thing we noticed when we got in the room was a really bad smell, i'm sure there arre better hotels in nicer areas, if you are mobile, i would recommend staying in the santa monica area and drive if you want to see the walk of fame.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY EVEN FOR A MINUTE!”
Reviews.Author: PTJT
Reviews.Content: Checked into this place on 4/3/2011, checked out same day, filthy room, blood on bedspread, filtyy pillow cases that were grey instead of white, when I said I was checking out that room was filthy, the man on the desk didnt care one bit, but of course I as charged $112.00 even though my cases were only in the room long enough for me to walk to Hollywood Boulevard find internet cafe and book another Hotel, if you are even thinking about this place DONT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great service. Great choice in the Hollywood area...”
Reviews.Author: ktown_traveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Right off of Sunset Blvd and in the heart of Hollywood. Rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. Great continental breakfast, and a very well maintained property....

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great service...”
Reviews.Author: monkgotgroove
Reviews.Content: The service here was fantastic. The location was right between Hollywood & Sunset - walking distance to great restaurants, shopping, entertainment. Parking was secure & below ground, the rooms were clean & quiet, really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Jwilly1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights whilst doing the typical Hollywood sights. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. If you are planning on being out most of the day and don't want to spend much money whilst being very close to Hollywood boulevard and the start of the walk of fame this should suffice. We had a night flight home and were able to leave our bags in reception after we checked out whilst we were sightseeing all day which was convenient. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Very good one”
Reviews.Author: harry411
Reviews.Content: I was hesitate to book this place due to some of negative reviews. I was wrong. The place is very good. The parking is free with underground garage, it's only 5'9" clearance so watch out your big SUV, mine is Highlander so it's OK. The room is very clean and the bed is comfortable, bath room is good. The balcony is made of iron but no big deal for me. I don't stay outside much. The wall & ceilling isolation is not good enough. You can hear people walking and talking but everything is quiet after 11PM. We had good sleep there. Breakfast is in a clean area with boiled eggs, english muffins, croisant, muffins, toast, orange & apple juices, coffe & tea. Everything is cold but what do you expect for this price. I'm happy with it. Beleive me if you want to save money and avoid bed bugs in Hollywood, try this inn. You won't be dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: leanne_janine
Reviews.Content: Dirty, was the first thing I thought when we arrived, after 24 hours travelling you don't really what to be put in a first floor room on a parking lot with iron grill outside that looks like a prison, I did ask for a pool view room before hand but as we arrived quite late we had to wait until the next day to be moved, when we did it was a nicer room the location is good just around the corner from hollywood walk of fame, graumans..etc.. and over the road is a supermarket to buy red bull in the mornings as the coffee was undrinkable, the breakfast was ok there are plenty of places to eat nearby and a very busy road right outside the receptionist recomended us a car rental place which was a complete rip off and a total nightmare good location but thats it

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Failure”
Reviews.Author: lajoan
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the noise situation that arose, and the atrocious customer service that followed, I would probably give them 3 or 4 stars. One night during our stay, the business next door--which was right outside of our room's door--was doing illegal jackhammer work in the middle of the night. When I complained, the night manager was useless. I ended up having to resolve the situation myself, and the jackhammer was finally put away at about 1:30am. The next day was ruined. When the night manager was unable to deal with the situation, I called the 800 number for Choice Hotels, and they only person to talk to was a reservation agent. This concerned me quite a bit. What if there were a real emergency going on? This chain--which includes over 6000 hotels--has no one at the corporate office to handle emergencies at their properties in the middle of the night?!?! Now, I understand this jackhammering wasn't a true emergency, just a big inconvenience for me personally. But, the fact that there was no one but a reservation agent available concerns me, and I doubt I will ever stay at a Choice Hotels location again because of it. They will take your reservation/money in the middle of the night, but not deal with problems. Afterwards, the company went through the motions of customer service following my complaint without actually providing any actual customer service. They sent me a personal email and made a phone call about a week after my stay, but didn't seem to understand the situation. They gave me an extra 3000 points in my "rewards account" for the trouble, which is basically worth nothing. The location was good and the bed was kinda comfy, which surprised me. But the custumer service after the incident was such a failure that I doubt I will ever stay at another Choice Hotels location again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to see Hollywood from”
Reviews.Author: jdubya59
Reviews.Content: I hemmed and hawed over which hotel to stay in and read many reviews. We chose this one based on value, location, and some of the review comments. There is a small drive through on La Brea, where we pulled in and my wife went inside to check us in. The whole process was less than 5 minutes and we used our key-card to enter the garage. (Hint: the card slides into a slot like in the room door, but from below) The garage will be a problem if you have a tall vehicle (more than 6 foot), but offers security and a cool location for your car (a plus in the summer). Many hotels in town charge as much as $10/day to park, but it is free here. Being off-season, finding a good parking spot was not an issue. Our room had a king size bed and was not as tight as one reviewer commented. There was enough room to do exercises on the floor and plenty of space for luggage. The refrigerator was cold enough to freeze a soda we had in the door. The furnishings appeared to be well kept and there were no problems with cleanliness. The rooms surround the pool area and the place had a Mediterranean courtyard feel. Our room didn't face the street and was quiet enough that we didn't know there was anyone else until room service knocked to check on whether we wanted the room made up. The continental breakfast wasn't fancy, but was better than some I have had. Pastries, English muffins, hard boiled eggs, cereal, milk, coffee, juice, etc. If you want something hot, besides toast, there are several eateries in the neighborhood. The free wireless worked well at both ends of our room. When we return to LA in the future, we will definitely put this establishment at the top of our list for options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: tracespace
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location. It's a few blocks from Graumann's Chinese Theatre and all the famous people's stars on Hollywood Boulevarde. Our room was huge and very clean. Big king size bed. The pool area was nice too although we were too busy partying to use it! The parking was very secure underneath. I would recommend this place. La Brea Avenue is very convenient for driving anywhere in LA. There's a close by Starbucks, Subway and a Ross "Dress For Less" if you're looking for cheap clothes whilst on holidays. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: sebastian_bark
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an affordable and nonsketchy hotel in the Hollywood area, I would highly recommend the Quality Inn on La Brea. It's just a quick walk up to all the Hollywood attractions and easily accessible to the 101 freeway and West Hollywood. In comparison to a lot of the other hotels in the area, the Quality Inn had great rates (even for weekends) and the front desk staff was extremely helpful, offering us the lowest possible rate they had. Despite being in a busy area, the hotel itself was quiet. My friend and I had a corner room, so barely anyone walked down past our room. Parking is free, which is a definite plus! Unfortunately, there are no elevators to access the 2 story building, which may not make it the best choice for anyone with wheelchairs or strollers. I believe a complimentary breakfast is offered in the morning, though I was never awake for it. Hotel was clean and well kept - the beds were extremely comfortable and the down pillows were soft and fluffy. Our room was equipped with a fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, and hair dryer. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Sums It Up!”
Reviews.Author: rebelyell18
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in need of a hotel while staying in LA. Upon driving by, it looked a lot nicer than other hotels in the area. We found it to be a great place with good rates. The room we had was really nice - clean, big, and well stocked. It was quiet there as well. The pool area looked nice but we did not go swimming. The only caveat in my mind is that there was no elevator to the second floor. Carrynig a heavy suitcase wasn't fun. In any event, the front desk staff were very nice and the room as a whole was excellent. I would definitely stay there again and will recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel; okay - Hollywood; disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Frnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for almost 2 weeks. We visited eveything in Los Angeles. We couldn't afford a more expensive hotel for the lenght of our stay. Didn't have any problem. Location; 5 minutes from the Kodak Theater and the Chinese Theatre. Right in the center of Holywood. However, Hollywood is not what people migh think it is. Do not confuse Beverly Hills and Hollywood or you might end up very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Labanese
Reviews.Content: We were 4 friends staying here 8 days in January 2009. This hotel has a really good location. Walk of fame is not even 5 minutes away, that is also where you will find the chinese theatere. If you need to do the laundry there is a laundry service across the street, and you have a lot of restaurants just outside the door. To be a 2 star hotel (which we don't get) this was excellent. The room was very clean, we had TV and a fridge, we also got new towels every day. Breakfast wass also included. The only minuses there were was that they only had butter and jam to put on the bread for breakfast. We therefore bought our own ham and cheese. One more thing that was annoying was that the cleaner came too early to clean the room... ...But then again... we found the "do not disturb" sign. Are you going to LA we would recomend this hotel wheter you are on a budget or not.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated as motel or hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Jasterock
Reviews.Content: Good location! 15 mins walk to Hollywood Blvd & Highland station. Burger King, Wendy's, In & Out Burger, House of pancakes, Subway, Guitar Center just around the corner along Sunset Blvd. This hotel is a bit run down, bedsheets very old. no lift ( you gotta drag your heavy luggages on your own to 2nd floor, nobody will give a hand, yes nobody cares!) Receptionist sucks big time, very unfriendly. Probably they don't welcome asian. $120 per night is way over-priced, more like $70. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Shady Area”
Reviews.Author: aussieKH
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as from our perceptions it appeared to be in an excellent location and extremely close to Hollywood, Mann's Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame. Yes, indeed, it was close; in fact, only a few minutes walking distance, however, from the moment we arrived in this 'hotel' - if you can call it that, we felt extremely unsafe. The hotel's price was moderate, though definately not cheap and it appeared to be clean and well kept and on the map looked nice and handy, which is why we chose it. Upon arrival we noticed that the bedding was soiled and full of holes and cigarette burns. The hotel is in a very dodgy area and the staff members are shady, pushy and unhelpful. Being an English speaking nation one would assume that hotel establishments would be fluent in the native language. Unfortunately this was not the case and we were certainly made to feel like foreigners (as we did not speak Spanish). The main concern for us in this situation was safety - or lack of. Walking out of the hotel we were confronted on several occasions by people that made us feel uncomfortable. Upon leaving the hotel and requesting a taxi to the airport the person at reception instead called his friend to take us insisting that no taxis would come at that time (1am). We were able to call a cab on our own. I would highly advise against staying in Hollywood, it is definately not the glitz and glamour that it appears on the t.v. or at the movies. If you must - stay in Beverley Hills - a little more expensive but worth the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nmetcher
Reviews.Content: $700 for 9 nights - great value. Great location, 5 minute walk from the Chinese Theatre. Great hidden treasure bar "The Woods" directly across the road. Right in the middle of it all but quiet room and locations, comfortable room, very clean, great AC and TV. Internet worked flaulessly. Ample free secured car parking. Front desk staff very friendly, George the manager is very accommodating. Had a great time in Hollywood - remember you NEED a car in LA. Can not fault this hotel - excellent value for money, great location, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “The Location Makes it Worth it”
Reviews.Author: jasonx
Reviews.Content: The Pros: Fairly well priced compared to the other hotels in the area. Excellent location, right between Sunset and Hollywood blvd. Walking distance to several attractions. Didnâ€™t use the pool but it appeared to be nice and clean. Complimentary breakfast. Has HBO. Large fridge and microwave in room. In-n-out burger right down Sunset â€“ not a big fan of fast food but their burgers are the best. Friendly staff. The Cons: Rooms are small, and furniture is oversized. We were in a king sized room and the space between the bed and other furniture (entertainment center, table, chair) was probably less than 12 inches. King bed is too big for the room. Got a peek inside a double bed room and we kind of wished we would have gotten one of those since they appeared to be more spacious. Rooms are dated. Walls are a little thin. It's a Motel. Summary: If you want to be in a good location and donâ€™t plan to spend a ton of time in your room, you really canâ€™t beat the price. There is a Comfort Inn down the street but it looked older. If youâ€™re going to be out and about checking out the Hollywood attractions, the bars, restaurants, etc., this makes a decent home base for a couple days. We were in town to visit friends and go to a concert at the House of Blues. Hollywood itself is not too impressive and probably wouldn't have visited otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Had ants in the room”
Reviews.Author: derby222
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance to Sunset Blvd and Hollywood Blvd. The only problems were that our room had ants crawling on the bathroom floor and walls and also ants by the front door. Also didn't feel completely safe... heard other hotel guests outside of our room late one night talking about using illegal drugs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, Hollywood disapointing”
Reviews.Author: comlab
Reviews.Content: The Qualtiy Inn near Hollywood Blv is nothing special, but okay for the near of the Walk of Fame. The AC was very loud, and the walls of the Hotel very thin. We were the first time in Hollywood and stayed 2 days, one for the Universal Studions one for Santa Monica and the rest of the City. We were disapointed about Hollywood, lot of Homeless and it's a dirty street. Next time we will stay in Santa Monica, it's nice there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A bit outdated but clean”
Reviews.Author: SherryBabie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because I was having a procedure done at nearby Cedar's Senai. The room was clean, however, their king bed was bouncey. Everytime either my husband or myself moved, the other would be jarred awake. We didn't sleep well at all. Secondly, although this was a non-smoking room, the bathroom door wouldn't stay open. When you would go in, you would get a blast of smoke smell. I was very ill recovering from the procedure, so this wasn't appreciated. Other than that, it really is a good location, there are lots of near-by restaurants as well as close to Hollywood attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: LVC2166
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked that that Quality Inn would allow a property like this to even have a franchise. The property is clearly old, but the condition of the room was shockingly grungy. To say "outdated" would be an understatement. It looks and felt old...very old. Peeling wallpaper, waterstains, chips and scratches everywhere...just nasty. It felt like a $20 a night room in a seedy downtown hotel, not $100+. They also screw you to pay for parking which, although not unheard of in many cities, is still a farce that shouldn't exist. Anyone should certainly be given a parking space with their $120 room fee, but they stick you for another $8 (if I recall). Additionally, I was awoken by vacuuming at 7:00AM! Seriously, they were vacuuming outside my room at 7am! Finally, the clerk who checked me in took way too long on his clearly personal phone call to even get around to giving us a room. This stay could have only been worse if I'd contracted smallpox from a vagrant who robbed me at gunpoint while in my room.... Oh, well, maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ammerammer
Reviews.Content: This Quality Inn is conveniently located near all the Hollywood attractions and is very close to a Metro station. There are numerous restaurants (including fast food) and stores all around it. Our rooms were clean but rather small. But we were there to see the sights and would recommend this hotel for its great location. The employees were very helpful, parking is convenient and free, and there is a nice pool and sun deck in the center of the hotel. While breakfast is included, there is not much to choose from. The rooms did have a refrigerator and microwave so you could supplement the breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Lillypad55
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We chose this hotel based on location. We wanted to visit Hollywood and be tourists - it was great. Within walking distance to Hollywood strip - Chinese theater, walk of stars, Hollywood Museum, shopping, Pig n Whistle.. short drive to the Rainbow & Key club... Starbucks & Burger King around the corner. Room was clean, nothing fancy - included fridge & microwave. Daily housekeeping, good stock of towels. Pool area was small, but quiet and clean. Overall we slept well, the front office staff was very helpful - they even printed our boarding passes. The parking garage is a little narrow to navigate, but we didn't seem to have any issues. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BabeMaine
Reviews.Content: In planning our trip to Hollywood, California I chose this hotel based on location, price and the number of positive reviews. We were not disappointed in our choice. It is conveniently located (as other reviews have stated) within walking distance to Hollywood Boulevard and is convenient to hop on the 101 or to go to Burbank to tour the movie studios. The room was very clean and we were pleasantly surprised how quiet it was (we asked for an inside room overlooking the swimming pool). The complimentary breakfast consisted of cereal, toast, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, juice, etc. If we travel to Hollywood again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: azerica
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed one night at the Quality Inn Hollywood, and found it to be clean, convenient, and quiet. The staff was pleasant and helpful. I chose this hotel based on reviews from this and other sites, and based on those reviews thought it was the best compromise in the area of price vs. acceptable level of quality. I think the choice turned out to be a very good one. It's not hard to find horror stories about most of the hotels in this area. None of those fears were realized in this hotel. The rooms was clean, well maintained, and even smelled nice. There were none of the bed bugs, soiled sheets, or prostitutes that are so common in reviews of other area hotels. The place isn't perfect. The rooms are small, and they didn't have any larger than two double beds when getting two beds in a room. There was still little floor space in the room. We got a roll away bed for a fifth member of our party, and we had to push the beds apart to make room for it, nearly filling the room with bed surface. Parking definitely is tight. There is some parking along the side of the hotel, but the spots are narrow. There is parking underneath, but those spots are narrow too and hard to get into. Not the place to bring your monster truck. But then, this whole part of town is not the place to bring your monster truck. The streets are narrow and traffic is busy. Some reviews complain about the seedy nature of this area. I would more describe it as colorful. It definitely has character. I think these people were more struck by the dissonance between the glitz and glamour implied by the word Hollywood and the reality of what Hollywood is. It's an old part of a major urban area. It is beaten up by the years and it shows its age. But hey, you travel to see interesting places, and this is one of them. However, the hotel is not a reflection of this dilapidated character, and is in fact well maintained and feeling like a retreat from the gritty chaos outside. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok ... not great ... not terrible ...”
Reviews.Author: marian31265
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delux Inn in Hollywood in Feb. 2007 for 2 nights. The room was clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked fine. We had a problem with one of the lamps which didnt work ...we reported it to the desk clerk on our way out the first day, and it was fixed/replaced when we returned an hour or two later. The location is right in the middle of Hollywood and close to all of the sites. It's right off of Sunset Blvd. which is not the greatest area. It's bordered on the other side by a residential street with a lot of apartments and is a much nicer area. It's close to several fast food restaurants (within a walk of a short block). The parking lot wasn't too bad. Parking was free...it is underground and might be difficult to park with a large SUV. On the outside of the hotel there also was a few off street parking spaces. There was usually one desk attendant on duty at a time (we saw 3 different ones over the course of our stay). All 3 were very pleasant. The continental breakfast wasn't anything special (cereal, juice, fruit, small muffins and toast). We originally booked the hotel when it was a Holiday Inn Express, and the price was affordable. I would say this hotel is on par with a Comfort inn or Best Western. I generally do not stay at a hotel that isn't part of a chain, if I'm unfamiliar with it. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I had booked a Holiday Inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tellte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this place last year and had a great time. We arrived again in January 07 and were amazed to see the name changed on the hotel and all the Holiday Inn stuff covered up. We asked at reception and were only then informed that it was no longer a Holiday Inn Express hotel. They were unhelpful and would not give us a contact number for Holiday Inn customer care. We decided to stay as we knew this area now and it is one of the best locations for exploring Hollywood and always felt very safe. Also, a different hotel at this late stage would have cost so much more. We had got a good deal over the Internet for an advanced booking. The first room was unsuitable because of electrical problems but the second room was better altough not quite the standard of the previous year. The maids did not clean quite a well as previously either. There was less of a supply of soap/shampoo etc also. The breakfast bar did not have the same selection of food and one day, we even had to ask at reception for some bread! However, since then it was better attended to. The staff were unfriendly at first this time but most cheered up a bit as time went by. The last night, we had very noisy guests next door. It seems security even had to intervene. The hotel were understanding and allowed us a discount because of this which was okay. When I returned home, I contacted Holiday Inn Express customer care and they say it is up to the hotel itself to inform people on the booking list that the place has changed hands and offer them the choice to cancel. It is not Holiday Inn's responsibilty to deal with these people. It is a warning to others who pay a little more for a brand name because this could happen to anyone and your position is a little vunerable when you are in this mess with no prior warning. Overall, we had a great holiday but next time, maybe we will choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed In Worse!”
Reviews.Author: absolut420
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. I've definitely stayed in worse (in LA, especially). First off, great location. Our room was clean and plenty big enough. I liked the fact that the underground parking garage was gate protected, but the ceiling was so low that I thought I was going to scrape the roof of our subcompact! Plus there was only one gate to get in/out and there was a hill you had to go up/down while hoping no one else was coming in/out at the same time as you were! The dial on our fridge was broken so it froze all our water and fruit! But that was our own fault for not complaining on day one when we realized it. The continental breakfast was less than stellar. Although the cinnamon rolls were delicious, everything else seemed as if it had been out too long. It also really disturbed me that they had milk sitting out at room temperature! And there was a fly caught in the breadbox the second morning we went there. Plus the staff lady that was in there had a foreign program turned up really loud on theTV and kept burping while we were trying to eat. Ew! So after two mornings of that, we decided to splurge on breakfast out the rest of the week. I think one of the biggest problems we had was that the last few mornings we slept in, and every day they would call our room around 11am to ask if we wanted room service (even though we had the Do Not Disturb sign out)! It didn't really occur to me until the last day when the call woke us up. It just seems really rude, especially in a party town like LA to wake your customer up every morning when they didn't ask for a wake-up call! And don't even get me started on the internet connection. it NEVER worked between 10am and 10pm every day. I was blogging my visit on my website and I would have to upload pictures and post my blog in the middle of the night because that was the only time the connection would work. BUT the location was great. We walked to Graumann's, Kodak Theater, and down Sunset (but to get to the actual Strip, you'll need a rental or a taxi because it's probably 3-4 miles away). I've definitely stayed in worse, but I'm not sure I woud stay here again. I think it costs more than it's worth, even with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible parking & questionable clientel”
Reviews.Author: flacaSandra
Reviews.Content: This place is a nightmare. I stayed here for work. No elevetos but horrible maze of stairwells. Parking is BAD... forget about parking underground if your car is larger than a compact. The room I had requested was unavailable at my check in and I was "upgraded" to a DIRTY room FULL of TRASH. Dont' get me started on the "working girls" who where my neighbors. I am all for people making a buck.. but come on... this was supposedly to be a family hotel???? I would have not stayed except it was for work, and working for a nonprofit, I try to mindful of our budgets. Stay @ the full service HI down the street instead!

Reviews.Title: “Another Express Crapshoot”
Reviews.Author: Scubatripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Hollywood based on the desire for an inexpensive hotel and because of the reviews I read here. The reviews were accurate, but the sum of my experience was less than expected. The Hotel is somewhat rundown and actually an old-style motel with rooms opening to an exterior walkway with no elevators. The decor is strictly early 1970s, semi-colonial and a little too beige for my comfort. It has individual wall air-conditioning which was difficult to calibrate and loud. I felt like the area, while slightly low-rent, was completely safe. One person mentioned the Burger King next door. That should tell you something about the neighborhood which is right on the corner of Sunset & La Brea. The free broadband connection was via ethernet, but it was very fast and easy to connect. The free parking is tight, as reported by others, and if you have trouble navigating an SUV in a suburban parking lot, you might want to consider a smaller car here. Overall, it was cheap, convenient, but a little depressing. And did I say that the parking and internet is Free? That saves you 30 buck a day right off the top. So, worth considering for the budget minded. In general, Holiday Inn Expresses are a crap shoot. If they are built from the ground up as Expresses, they tend to be really good. But if they are converted from older hotels, results, like this one, are a little less viable

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rjturner
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and wasnt too sure (mixed messages). Overall we loved it. Great location, the breakfast was a nice bonus, felt safe in the area and free parking Pros Location short walk to everything Hollywood, Breakfast was good Area felt safe late into the night Free Parking Friendly staff Nice Pool Cons Parking was very tight, felt like austin powers trying to leave I would stay there again no problem

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: steadyeddie100
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, but the ever helpful George let us in early. Good Breakfast. Clean rooms. Just down the road from Hollywood Boulevard. Ten minutes from Universal, and about 45 mins from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It - Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: MaryOviedo
Reviews.Content: It is everthing it says it is not. It is not in a safe neighborhood if you are traveling alone. The room was stale smelling, musty and not in good repair. I stay at Holiday Inn Express locations all the time, and this is the worst. Their reveiws say they are only 1 mile from Sunset Strip...they are really 4 miles from where you would want to go. The walk to Hollywood Blvd, although ok during the day, is not one I would take alone at night as their are bums and homeless people all along the way. So, unless you want to take a taxi, you will miss the night life of Hollywood and Highland. I called before I went to ensure that it was safe to walk around and easy access as they stated. I was assured this was the case. It was not. Take it from a person who walks the streets of New York City and Chicago at night. This is not a place to stay if you want to feel secure. Also, the hotel is in poor condition and the cost is high for what they give you. Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and just as good”
Reviews.Author: melbourneatheart
Reviews.Content: For the price of this hotel, you can't get much better - especially with the included breakfast. We flew in after a horror 15 hour flight where we didn't get any sleep and it was 10.30am when we arrived and they hurried to get us a room that we could check into. This was a blessing in itself as we were able to make the most of our weekend in LA whilst the oscars were there, before going to NYC. Take the long walk down La Brea and line up at Pinks for a hot dog if you are looking for something to do but seriously you don't need anything else with In N Out just around the corner!! :) Always reliable and I will be staying there again most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: adnaw
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel with average rooms, but the location is good for touring Hollywood and it was easy to get downtown to the convention center. The staff was very helpful - our internet access did not work at first, but the cable was replaced quickly. The breakfast was enjoyable - the cinnamon rolls were especially delicious. We felt like the room was fairly clean, if a little dated. Our only real problem was parking. While we appreciated the security of the gate and underground parking, it was very cramped. We were in a Pontiac Montana minivan and getting in and out of the parking spaces was very difficult. Overall, we did feel safe at the hotel even though we were in a somewhat questionable neighborhood. At $150 per night, it seemed like an awful lot to pay for the room, especially after enjoying the MGM Grand in Vegas for only $80. Had I paid less than $100 per night I would probably rate this as an Above Average hotel. I suppose that is all about the location and our timing, however.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little dim and cramped but generally fine. The hotel seemed safe/secure, the breakfast was quite decent, and the location was pretty good, being right around the corner from the Walk of Fame etc. Good value for what and where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelgSenior
Reviews.Content: Since I wanted to stay in Hollywood, I couldn't have picked a better hotel. Reasonable price, good breakfast, nice shower, thick towels, nice sheets and pillows and comfy bed. The room was not big but it did have 2 double beds, 2 chairs, a table plus an armoire for the TV and drawers. The hotel was very secure. The refrigerator was bigger than usual. The only negative thing is that it is not very soundproof so just bring your ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for location...”
Reviews.Author: MarkusSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Pros: Conveniently located hotel - close to walk of fame and most Hollywood sights. Secure parking. Cons: Smelly room, didn't really feel in a clean place there. Definetely too expensive for the room quality. But, as I mentioned in the title, you're paying for the convenient location. Although the neighbourhood does not look too inviting, we felt OK (regarding safety). We were happy that they had enclosed underground parking - wouldn't have wanted to leave the car out in the open. Front desk staff was extremely helpful. They even made photocopies of a detailled downtown map for us to help us find an address there.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value”
Reviews.Author: munjarra
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 young children recently stayed in this hotel for 2 nights after flying from Australia. We rented a car and found it quite easily. The hotel is certainly not luxury but is excellent value at $104. The room had 2 doubles and was adequately sized although not overly large. Bathroom and room facilities were fine. Complementary breakfast was served in a small but adequate dining room with a large choice of offerings. This alone saved us $$.Complementary parking was also provided in a secure lot. The parking area was spacious but one had to be careful when reversing in and out of your space. Location wise excellent within walking distance of Hollywood Boulevarde and a 10 minute drive from Beverly Hills. Car required. The surrounding locality is not particularly attractive but that would be the only drawback. Front desk was efficient but not much else. No porterage provided and no lift. At the price we paid its a great find and recommended. If you want a luxury hotel in Beverly Hills then stay elsewhere. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was much different”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there in January. The first room reeked of fresh booze and had red ants in the closet. They were nice and apologized and moved us to another room. That room was dirty and the sheets were stained with a black substance, but we were too tired to move again. Very pleasant at the front desk, but not well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel and free parking”
Reviews.Author: ramblingranny
Reviews.Content: My husband I and stayed here one night before we visited the King Tutankhamen exhibit at the LACMA in Sept. '05. It is close but NOT within walking distance to the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and the La Brea Tarpits. We paid $129 for an unexceptional room with a pool view. The room was OK. Breakfast was adequate, served in a small room. The parking lot was incredibly small and difficult to access, under the building, off a side street. But heavily fortified with lots of barbed wire and seemed safe and secure. A large pick-up truck would not fit- our minivan barely made it. That said, the parking is free- unusual in LA. This hotel is really not conveniently close to any LA attractions, although it is in a quiet location. We would probably stay here again. It was in Hollywood and there were lots of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: ekehat
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights on a visit to the Universal Studios theme park. The location was simply perfect for that purpose - about a mile from the studios' entrance. Also, close enough to Hollywood Blvd. (about 5 minutes drive) so there are lots of dining options close by. The hotel and the room are very well decorated and equipped, better than other Holiday Inn's I've been to. On the other hand, the pool is a joke, so if that's what you're looking for, forget it. Also, there were signs of maintenance problems - our room's window latch was broken, there was a patch of duct tape on the bathroom door, bucket in the corridor to catch dripping from the roof, and a very slow elevator. There's pretty good breakfast included. We paid $108 per night, which is a bargain in my opinion. I definitely recommend the place if you're visiting Hollywood. The good (location, price, breakfast) far exceeds the bad.

Reviews.Title: “HOLLYWOOD!!! What you see is what you get!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at here on a girls trip. The hotel is very basic. Staff are very friendly and even gave us chairs to stand in line at the Price is Right. There is a help desk in the lobby. The location is excellent. It's close to CBS, a wonderful outdoor shopping centre, and close to all the sights Hollywood is known for. The famous Kodak Theatre is a few km's away. You could walk to it. You would definitely have to rent a vehicle if staying here. Although it is central to everything including Rodeo Drive which was better than I imagined , Burbank which was sparkling clean and where NBC is, the Hollywood Hills, Santa Monica pier and other famous areas such as Beverly Hills are definitely areas to visit with a vehicle. The hotel is right across the street from a Starbucks and sub shop not too mention there are also great restaurants within walking distance too. The traffic is horrendous during peak hours and LA drivers are exactly what you see on tv..always in a rush and crazy drivers. The hotel location for the price can't be beat. The room was very basic yet clean all the time. Parking was expensive at approx $15 per day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel was grubby, but so was the whole area. Inside the staff were welcoming and helpful. The pool looked quite inviting and the rooms were large and comfortable, although a bit dark. The complimentary breakfast was as good as any other that we had in California. Being only two blocks away from Hollywood Boulevard, the Holiday Inn La Brea was an ideal tourist base. Speeding cars and sirens woke us a couple of times during the night, so donâ€™t go there if it is peace and quiet that you are after; but by what we saw of Hollywood this was actually quite a decent area. It is unlikely that I would ever return to Hollywood, but if I did, I would stay here!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CARMINO
Reviews.Content: Hotel was and is convienient to many places, you can leave your car at hotel and walk to Hollywood Blvd. Room I felt was small, shower head did not impress me. Pool was clean but the feet numbers along side were dirty. The breakfast was a continental breakfast and not a deluxe breakfast as the say. Staff was pleasant but not overly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money....exactly like reviews said”
Reviews.Author: chitowntrvlrs
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is exactly what other comments have said, a very good value for the price. We were given rooms on the 2nd floor towards the back and didn't hear any of the street noise other people have mentioned. Both rooms were clean, the overall condition of the hotel was good and the free continental breakfast suits the basic needs. The parking is tight and yes, any oversized vehicle will have some problems if the driver isn't aware of his/her surroundings. Everything in the hollywood area is close by foot or a short cab ride away. The staff behind the counter was attentive to any needs that we presented them, from additional towels, to suggestions of restaurants or local sites. We would stay at this hotel again if planning a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good - for it's price”
Reviews.Author: Marcel_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Based on all positive reviews on this Tripadvisor site, we selected this hotel. And I am glad we did, since afterwards we can confirm most of the positive remarks. Only minor points: LaBrae av. is quite noisy, and my first night was a bad one due to the traffic you could hear and feel passing by. Moreover, one man at the front desk more or less begged for a tip after early check-in, since he stressed some five times the trouble he has gone through realising it. That's not very neat. Despite that, it was a good decision to select this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just as everyone said”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just as everyone else said - clean rooms, good location, nice breakfast. I had a room in the back corner and slept wonderfully. I felt very safe traveling by myself and staying at this hotel. Will stay here again - paid $109/night plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great place for the price! I stayed here over memorial day weekend (booked it b/c of all the reviews I read here). I really had no complaints whatsoever....the rooms were clean and spacious, the bathroom was very clean with an actual tub and not one of those nasty stalls. The room had a closet and a nice mini-fridge. The continental breakfast was in a separate room from the lobby and was also quite nice. The hot cinnamin buns were fabulous, but also cereal, bagels, fruit, all that stuff. Parking was free and plenty...the underground garage made me feel like my car was safe, although maneuvering the car down there was a bit challenging. Pool and grounds were clean. And last but not least..friendly staff, good price and a GREAT location a couple blocks from Hollywood Blvd, walk of fame, wax museum, etc. We even walked down there past midnight and felt fine...there were lots of people around but mostly harmless club-goers.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: theewhitehouse
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend this month at this nice, clean, friendly, safe, above average 2 star hotel. Rooms were small but adequate. Close to the touristy stuff that you could walk it. Felt safe walking about during the day. Definitely keep your eyes open at night, just like any busy city. Staff was very helpful without asking. Continental breakfast was just enough to start your day. Small pool in the center courtyard was clean & surrounded with loungers, tables & chairs. I would stay here again. Luxury its not. If you're looking for a place that is clean, inexpensive, safe & has the basic ammenities, this is the place. Free gated parking, internet access, toiletries & a fridge in the room are definite pluses. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bennos_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed early April 2005, and were pleasantly suprised with this motel and its location. The room was small, but clean and also had a small refrigerator (which we turned off at night as it was noisy). Our room faced the back of a building next door (facing Sunset Blvd), there was a lot of noise at night from the sirens, helicopters and general traffic noise but that is just LA i guess. The location was very convenient for what we needed, i.e. access to the tourist areas such as Hollywood Bvld, Sunset Blvd, Melrose etc. Also, close to bus stops and walking distance to nearest metro station. Felt reasonably safe walking around this area at night. A convenience store is located close to the hotel and also an internet cafe (cnr Sunset and La Brea) if you are not travelling with a laptop (the rooms have free wifi access). Many restaurants are also within walking distance - we MUST recommend the pizza place upstairs in the Kodak Theatre complex. The Margarita pizza was the best we have had anywhere (including New York) and the guy who works there is really friendly (he offered us a lift to Anaheim!). Hotel includes a simple but more than adequate continental breakfast and staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Yves
Reviews.Content: Hey, I stayed at this hotel for about 5 nights. The location is quite good. Not that far away from hollywood blvd and the touristic stuff. The only minor thing is the traffic in that area. I had a room at the sunset blvd side and that was pretty noisy, especially the first night since i'm used to sleep in a quiet area. But i got used to it pretty fast, maybe because i was tired too :) Every morning i got my free newspaper and breakfast (oh i really like those cinnamon rolls...) . In the room they have free internet access and i must say i really was surprised i had a microwave and fridge in my room, which is pretty nice. That way i could save money on eating out ;). Staff is very friendly. e.g. on my last day i asked some info about getting to the airport. The guy at the counter was so friendly to make reservations for a cab and he said i could check out at noon instead of 11 am since i only had a flight 3 pm. Not that big a deal, but it's the details that make it worth while sometimes. I'm from europe and i've been in pretty small rooms in hotels (e.g paris and amsterdam). The rooms were spacious in this hotel with a very nice bathroom and shower. So i think this is an ideal hotel if you don't want big luxury but some comfort for a good price. greetings, Yves

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: CaptainTongo
Reviews.Content: On the corner of La Brea and Sunset it is well situated for tourist places such as The Walk of Fame. The room was clean and spacious and the bedding and towels changed daily. Breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff friendly. There are plenty of fast-food establishments within walking distance. The big plus is the safe and secure underground parking. We were staying on business this trip, and would certainly return here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 1520 North La Brea Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90028
